question_title: Will BAC's market close price on 2026-02-15 be higher than its market close price on 2026-02-02?
summary: Over a ~10 trading day horizon (Feb 2 to Feb 13/15), stock price movements are largely random with slight positive drift. BAC has strong fundamentals (beat Q4 estimates) but faces headwinds from the credit card rate cap proposal that has made financials the worst S&P sector in 2026. All known information (analyst targets, earnings) is already priced in. The base rate for a large-cap stock being higher over ~2 weeks is approximately 52-53%. With offsetting positive and negative factors, this resolves to essentially a coin flip with slight positive drift.

factors.description: Base rate: Large-cap stocks historically up ~52-53% over 2-week periods due to positive market drift
Strong Q4 2025 earnings: Beat on NII (+$240M), equity trading (+23%), positive CEO outlook
Credit card rate cap headwind: Trump proposal sent banking shares tumbling, financials worst S&P sector in 2026
Stock down from recent high: ~8% decline from Jan 5 ATH of $57.55 to current ~$53
No major catalysts: No earnings, dividends, or FOMC meetings in Feb 2-15 window - movement largely random
Efficient markets adjustment: Analyst bullishness and earnings already priced in
